title: Alex Morgan announces she is due to give birth three months before US Women’s National Team head to Tokyo 2020
text:
Alex Morgan, one of the big stars of the World Cup-winning United States women's football team, has announced that she is due to give birth just three months before the Tokyo Olympics.

The 30-year-old striker, who co-captains the US team, took to Twitter to announce her pregnancy, saying that she and LA Galaxy footballer Servando Carrasco are expecting a baby girl in April 2020.

The football at the Tokyo Olympics starts on July 22nd and the US team will be sorry to see one of their most important players likely ruled out for this tournament in particular.

The United States will have their eyes set on winning gold as at the last Olympics, in 2016, Germany ended their run of three gold medals in a row. The United States have won the last two World Cups back to back and will be hungry to add the next Olympics to their list of titles.

Morgan has scored 107 goals in 169 games for the US national team, having played with them since 2010. At the summer’s World Cup she was the joint-top goalscorer with six goals, taking home the Silver Boot award.

Many will remember Morgan for her controversial tea drinking celebration when she scored in the semi-final that saw England knocked out of the World Cup.
